Class Genetics

  • java.lang.Object
    • Genetics
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RankGenetics, RouletteWheelGenetics, TournamentGenetics

    public abstract class Genetics
extends java.lang.Object
    An environment for our chromosomes to live and reproduce for finding a result to our equation until they converge or reach a maximum number of generations

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> _allFitnesses
      All best fitness values of each generation

      Number of cuts to make in genes to cross them

      Is simulation paused

      Name of this environment
      static double BIGGEST_SOLUTION
      Highest possible outcome of the equation

      The maximum possible fitness difference worst and the best chromosomes for reproduction to stop

      All chromosomes currently living in this environment
      static double SMALLEST_SOLUTION
      Lowest possible outcome of the solution

    • Constructor Detail

      • Genetics

        public Genetics(java.lang.String _name,
                int maxPopulation,
                int maxGeneration,
                int mutationPercentage,
                double convergenceThreshold,
                int crossoverPoints)
        Creates an environment based on given parameters
        Parameters:
        _name - name of this environment
        maxPopulation - maximum chromosomes that can live in a generation in this environment
        maxGeneration - maximum number of generations until reproduction stops
        mutationPercentage - percentage of possible mutations in each gene of each chromosome after each reproduction
        convergenceThreshold - maximum difference between worst and the best fitness for reproduction to stop
        crossoverPoints - number of cuts to make in genes to cross them

    • Method Detail

      • Start

        public void Start()
        Starts simulating this environment Does the: Generate the initial population Compute fitness REPEAT Selection Crossover Mutation Compute fitness UNTIL population has converged Method.

      • GetFittest

        public Chromosome GetFittest()
        Finds and returns the fittest chromosome in the current environment
        Returns:
        fittest chromosome

      • IsConverged

        private boolean IsConverged()
        Finds if the difference of fitness between the best and the worst are lower than our threshold
        Returns:
        true if there is a really low chance of getting new different chromosomes, false otherwise

      • GeneratePopulation

        private Chromosome[] GeneratePopulation()
        Generates an initial population
        Returns:
        a population of randomly generated chromosomes

      • Select

        protected abstract Chromosome[] Select()
        Selects parents in the current environment
        Returns:
        a list of 2 chromosomes for each parent

      • Crossover

        protected Chromosome[] Crossover(Chromosome parent1,
                                 Chromosome parent2)
        Crosses over two chromosomes based on some cut points
        Parameters:
        parent1 - first parent to sample
        parent2 - second parent to sample
        Returns:
        children with crossed over genes from parents

      • Mutate

        private Chromosome[] Mutate(Chromosome[] children)
        Mutates children based on the equation rule and a percentage of mutation on each gene
        Parameters:
        children - children to mutate
        Returns:
        mutated versions of given children chromosomes

      • MutateGene

        private double MutateGene(double n)
        Mutates a single gene
        Parameters:
        n - gene to mutate
        Returns:
        randomly bit flipped version of the given gene

      • Pause

        public void Pause()
        Pauses the simulation

      • Continue

        public void Continue()
        Continues the simulation

      • Stop

        public void Stop()
        Resets the environment and stops simulating
